items.title: Full Time: Enterprise Support Engineer; Japanese Language (Remote- Japan) at GitHub in Remote-Japan
items.content:
GitHub is looking for full-time Enterprise Support Engineers to provide Japanese-language support for our customers in Japan.

More and more companies are using GitHub Enterprise, so our global Enterprise Support Team is quickly growing. When our customers have problems, they contact us and it is our goal to help them as quickly, and awesomely as possible. We're looking for Japanese language Enterprise Support Engineers to join our Asia Pacific Support team. This role is remote, but candidates must currently be located in Australia, Japan, or New Zealand and possess legal working authorization.

At GitHub, we take support seriously, and this is not an entry-level position. Our Enterprise Support Engineers are responsible for helping our GitHub Enterprise customers who have our product installed and managed in the customer's virtualization environment. Your main responsibility will be to work with our customers to solve support tickets. Tickets are usually opened by internal system administrators, and can include investigating load or networking issues, debugging application errors, and discussing feature requests. You'll also work with our engineering team to prioritize issues and development, and our documentation team to improve customer-facing resources. You don’t need to be a Git expert, but you do need to have technical experience and a passion for helping people.

The position reports to an Enterprise Support Manager and works closely with other teams and leaders across the company. GitHub works remotely and asynchronously as much as possible. While this role does not require you to live near one of our offices, it will require some travel to meet with co-workers or attend company events.

Responsibilities:

  • Solve complex customer support tickets often involving Linux servers, source code, and web application issues
  • Effectively communicate technical information to customers and engineering groups at GitHub
  • Work proactively with customers on activities such as coordinating upgrades, communicating upcoming features, and ensuring their installation is running smoothly
  • Identify bugs and improvements in the GitHub Enterprise codebase
  • Manage urgent customer outages during business hours

Minimum Qualifications:

  • Current legal working authorization in Japan
  • Experience with Linux
  • General understanding of how modern web applications work
  • Prior experience providing technical support
  • Excellent problem-solving skills
  • Familiarity with some flavor of production-level virtual machine (e.g., VMware ESX, Xen, KVM)
  • Enthusiasm for working directly with customers
  • Stellar Japanese and grammar skills
  • Business level English skills

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Worked closely with large complex customer accounts
  • Familiarity with Git and GitHub
  • Experience with phone support
  • The ability to look through and understand code (Ruby / Bash)
  • Previous experience as a Linux System Administrator
  • Previous experience providing on-site consulting or professional services

Who We Are:

GitHub is the best place to share code with friends, co-workers, classmates, and complete strangers. Over fifteen million people use GitHub to build amazing things together. With the collaborative features of GitHub.com and GitHub Business, it has never been easier for individuals and teams to write faster, better code.

What We Value:

Collaboration: We believe the best work is done together. Empathy: We believe in putting people first. Quality: We believe in setting the standard for excellence. Positive Impact: We believe in making the world a better place through our work. Shipping: We believe in creating things for the people using them.

Why You Should Join:

At GitHub, we're committed to quality, collaboration, experimentation...and shipping!

We constantly strive to create an environment that allows our employees (Hubbers) to do the best work of their lives. We've designed one of the coolest workspaces in San Francisco (HQ), where over half of our Hubbers work, snack, and create daily. The other half of our Hubbers work remotely in 18 countries across the globe. Additionally, we enable Hubbers who are not based in HQ, to have the flexibility to work in ways that are most effective for them (at home, in a workspace, etc).

We are also committed to keeping Hubbers healthy, motivated, focused and creative. We've designed our top-notch benefits program with these goals in mind. In a nutshell, we've built a place where we truly love working, we think you will too.

GitHub is made up of people from a wide variety of backgrounds and lifestyles. We embrace diversity and invite applications from people of all walks of life. We don't discriminate against employees or applicants based on gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, race, religion, age, national origin, citizenship, disability, pregnancy status, veteran status, or any other differences. Also, if you have a disability, please let us know if there's any way we can make the interview process better for you; we're happy to accommodate!

*Please note that benefits vary by country, if you have any questions, please don't hesitate to ask your Recruiter!

Your main responsibility will be to work with our customers to solve support tickets. GitHub works remotely and asynchronously as much as possible. While this role does not require you to live near our office, it will require some travel to meet with co-workers or attend company events.

items.title: Customer Experience Assistant
items.content:
*UK CX Assistant full-time - 5 days a week including Saturday and Sunday*

Harry’s is a men’s grooming brand that was built out of respect for quality craftsmanship, simple design, modern convenience and for guys who know they shouldn’t have to overpay for a great shave. We are able to deliver exceptional value and experiences to our customers because we are vertically integrated. From grinding steel into fine razors blades at our factory in Germany to selling our products directly to customers on our website and select retailers, we own the entire process.

Since launching in early 2013, we have been blown away by the customer response to our brand. Today, we have over 3 million customers and are growing fast. We’re now looking to bring amazing people, like you, together to redefine the way people interact with brands online and in stores across the country.

*About the Team*
At Harry's, the customer is at the heart of everything that we do. The Customer Experience Team serves as the bridge between Harry's and the amazing people who use our products. We're the voice of Harry's to our customers and advocates for our customers to the rest of the Harry's team. From new products to marketing initiatives to our website, everything we do is directly influenced by our customers. As a Customer Experience Assistant you'll drive that change, and have a lot of fun doing it!

*About the Role*
As a Customer Experience Assistant you will work directly with our customers as we continue to grow our brand in the UK, answering their questions about everything from delivery times to how often they should shave. You will also work closely with the Customer Experience Team at Headquarters in New York to develop and execute creative ideas for improving the customer experience overall. The UK operation has grown very quickly and now requires someone who can work from home answering customers during the weekends, as well as from the office for three days during the week.

*What you will accomplish:*
* Thrive in a fast-paced environment tackling an array of customer issues via phone, email and chat
* Become an expert on our products and spread the love of Harry's everywhere
* Deliver above-and-beyond customer service by surpassing our customer's everyday expectations
* Be the primary contact for Harry’s customers who get in touch over the course of the weekend
* Find new and interesting ways to make our customers smile
* Create instant rapport with our customers
* Strategise ways to improve our service, streamline our processes, and better serve our customers
* Master our internal management system in order to efficiently and effectively manage customer relationships
* Coordinate with CX Management to channel customer feedback to all areas of the business such as technology, marketing, design and product teams
* Identify customer trends in real time and communicate to the CX team and other departments
* Dive in wherever needed as we launch our UK operations

*This should describe you:*
* Clear communicator via our customer service channels – both on email and phone. You can explain how to use an iPhone to your Grandma. And get her on Instagram too.
* Empathetic to the extreme - you have the ability to meet the customer where they are and immediately put yourself in their shoes
* A knack for building rapport with people quickly and easily
* A strong work ethic and an entrepreneurial spirit
* Eager to learn, grow, and develop your professional skills
* Ability to problem solve and think on your feet, with analytical skills a huge, huge plus
* You take initiative to solve problems and get the job done
* General awesomeness and a sense of humor
* Strong start-up mentality, which a "no task is too small" attitude
* Self-motivated and grit to get things done, even when there’s no-one else around
* Flexible outlook and keenness to support other areas of the UK team as required
* Able to work weekends

*Here's who you'll work with:*
* Report directly to the UK Customer Experience Manager
* Work with awesome CX Assistants, in your office and across the pond in the US, who work hard and make the everyday fun
* Work with the rest of your UK-based team to build and grow the Harry's team culture

items.title: QuickMail.io: Exceptional Customer Support Specialist
items.content:
Exceptional Customer Support Specialist

Posted Oct 9

QuickMail.io
Headquarters: World
https://quickmail.io/jobs/

WE’RE GROWING AGAIN!


How is this job different?

Working for a self-funded startup like QuickMail means a lot of freedom and ability to build close bonds with each user. We strive to be anti-corporate, we remove all possible walls between the users and us to truly deliver an exceptional experience.

We don’t have investors to please, just our users.

FAST is the mantra here, we want people who can think and work fast.

You’ll get plenty of hands-on experience since there are so many things to do.

Pro-activity & curiosity as well as personal development is highly valued and not only encouraged but mandatory.

Who we are

QuickMail is a sales automation tool for sending B2B cold emails. Small and medium businesses use it to reach out to potential customers in their market and grow their business.

We hit product market fit very fast and are growing quickly. We need help from enthusiastic people who want to be part of this journey.

We are a 100% customer funded start-up, so decisions are made fast between the team for the good of the customers.

We care about helping our customers deeply, so if this means recommending another tool more suited to their needs, so be it.

Check out our values here: http://quickmail.io/values/ and unlike most corporate BS, we do stand by this. Please don’t apply if this doesn’t resonate with you, you won’t be happy here.

The work

We work remotely and cover US hours. We are metrics and result driven, we are more focus on achievement than business or being busy.

This is a full-time position.

Your primary responsibilities will be to make sure user problems are resolved and ensuring the help documentation is up to date.

Requirements

You have great critical reasoning skills, while acting fast in a self-reliable manner.

You are tech savvy with a good internet connection.

You have empathy for users experiencing problems.

You relish challenges and are persistent.

Excellent writing (email & live chat).

Previous experience working remotely is highly valued.

Must have at least 2 years in customer support role and in case I ask for it, the magic word to show me you read this page is banana.

You will…

Get to grow the customer success and support department.
Work directly with the founder who understands the importance of delighting users.
Work remotely from anywhere in the world. No need to commute to work (you just need a good and stable internet connection at all time).
You’ll grow tremendously if you can keep up with the pace

Apply for this position

Read our core values first: https://quickmail.io/values/ - If this looks like you, send an email to jobs@quickmail.io with this exact subject: “I’m a unicorn”, and containing absolutely nothing else but a link to your linked in profile.

items.title: Technical Support and Customer Success @ DISCO
items.content:
Technical Support and Customer Success @ DISCO

2017-10-09 05:28

Description

Who we are

We're a music tech startup based in Melbourne. Our app, DISCO, helps people and companies who work with music manage their music assets and workflow.

The role

We're looking for someone to join us in a support and customer success role.

The role will primarily involve providing technical support to our customers and assisting them with getting set up on the platform and managing their assets. It will also involve some administrative tasks and working with the sales, product and development teams to grow the product and our customer base.

There's lots of opportunities to learn and do new things in a supportive environment.

We're looking for someone part time initially. For the right person, this could quickly grow into a long term, full time position as we grow.

While we don't necessarily need you to have experience in a start up environment, we are looking for someone technically adept who learns quickly, communicates clearly and is keen to pursue a career in software.

We work in a distributed team, headquartered in Melbourne. You would need to have at least 3-4 hours crossover with Australian Eastern Standard Time business hours.

Please provide a cover letter that tells us about:

  • what technical experience you have

  • why you're interested in working in a software startup

  • what makes good user experience.

Please note cover letters need to address all three of these points for us to consider your application.

This is a great opportunity to join a strong, supportive team and develop your career in software.

What we need

Things we need:

  • very strong attention to detail

  • very good written and verbal communication skills (you proof things before you send them; you can write quickly and accurately with the right tone and sound like a human)

  • curiosity and willingness to read up on things you don't know about, and stay on top of trends in technology and things that affect our start up and your role within it

  • strong technical fluency (you pick up new things quickly and like to know how things work)

  • excellent analytical skills (able to troubleshoot problems quickly and efficiently)

  • extremely organised, and able to set up systems for yourself and others

  • able to work independently and quickly, and multi task.

Benefits

Supportive environment, and strong opportunities for growth and advancement within the team. Flexible working hours, and capacity to take ownership and drive key initiatives within the business.

Country

Anywhere*

Location

Crossover with AEST required: need to be able to work, at a minimum, 7-11am AEST year round

items.title: Technical Support Engineer (Enterprise Customer Success)
items.content:
We're looking for a Technical Support Engineer to join our growing team with the goal of making our customers successful. If you love solving tech problems, enjoy working with all types of customers from around the world (startups to corporations), and love variety, this job has it all.

The Technical Support Engineer contributes to the team’s mission of making customers successful and enabling them to realize business value, so they remain customers for life. We have high expectations around giving our customers quick, accurate, and awesome support so they can focus on doing what they do best. In addition to answering customer questions, support tasks include leading projects to drive efficiency, documenting knowledge so customers can self-solve questions, and develop tools that allow our client to be more satisfied with Piwik and InnoCraft.


What you will do:


  • Deliver happiness to every customer you interact with by answering their questions via phone and email (or by any means necessary).
  • Guide customers through implementation, onboarding, business reviews, renewal and anything that comes in-between.
  • Become more knowledgeable about our web & mobile analytics products than anyone else, and become an expert in the larger analytics space.
  • Debug customer issues, keeping ownership of cases until resolution while engaging other teams as needed.
  • Develop your skills in cutting-edge web technologies (JavaScript, jQuery, CSS, HTML, mobile development, etc.), used on our customers’ websites and apps.
  • Ensure that Piwik and InnoCraft are delivering business value.
  • Contribute to improving our processes, systems, and customer interactions by initiating and driving innovative projects to help our clients become even more successful.
  • Availability to be on call for emergency issues that arrive during off hours.


    Within your first few months, you should should expect the following:


  • 30 days: Learn how to answer customer questions, be familiar with Piwik solutions, positioning, competition, and product suite. Internalize our success stories, our systems and our processes. You’ll shadow every possible sales and customer success meetings with existing clients.
  • 60 days: Begin to take on your own portfolio of accounts and lead onboarding processes for new customers. Become fluent in their history, their goals with Piwik, and define a plan to make these accounts successful.
  • 90 days: You’ll be fully ramped and executing against your portfolio of customers. You’ll have ownership over the engagement, retention, and growth of these clients.


    Requirements:


  • Customer-orientation and excellent communication skills
  • Ability to manage multiple priorities, commitments and projects.
  • Excellent technical troubleshooting skills
  • Self-motivated, directed and passionate about what you do. Strives for results.
  • Experience in client-side web development (JavaScript, Jquery, HTML, CSS, AJAX)
  • Willingness to participate on-call rotation during off-hours and weekends
  • Experience working or using web analytics (eg. Piwik or Google Analytics)
  • (Bonus) Familiar with programming language like PHP
  • (Bonus) Experience with databases and SQL queries


    Location


  • Remote work position.
  • As our customers are mostly located in Europe, your work day must match the working day in CET. We will consider applicants from UTC-4 timezone (USA or Canada or South america East coast) and in Europe timezones.


    Benefits


  • A rewarding salary
  • Working with fun and energetic people
  • A good work/life balance
  • Remote work
  • Part time possible
  • Flexible hours
  • A huge “playground” to grow your skillset
  • Immediate impact


    About InnoCraft and Piwik


    At InnoCraft, we offer analytics products & services to enable our users to grow their business. We believe in openness, privacy and 100% data ownership and we created Piwik to fulfil our mission to liberate analytics.

    Our team is filled with customer focused individuals that champion and support our products used by a growing list of customers globally. We challenge one another every day and hold ourselves accountable for our work product as well as our customer's overall success. We all enjoy the interactions with the customers, problem solving, digging into complex issues, and actively championing for customers within InnoCraft. We wake up every morning asking ourselves how we can improve the customer's experience, the quality of our product, the quality of our support system, or our individual weaknesses. We are not scared of challenges, nor do we back down or get deterred by tough problems. When problems seem the hardest we are at our best, we work harder to find the root cause and a solution. We are acombination of passion and persistence.We feel that through our roles we can positively impact millions of end-users and their experience with Piwik Analytics and InnoCraft products.


    Apply online Apply online here.


    We’re looking forward to receiving your application!

items.title: WordPress Developer & Support Specialist
items.content:
View the full posting at: https://cornershopcreative.com/help-wanted-wordpress-developer-support-specialist/
Cornershop Creative (https://cornershopcreative.com) is seeking an awesome, U.S.-based WordPress developer to join our distributed team.The core responsibility for this position will be investigating, troubleshooting, and coding solutions for WordPress-based websites and applications for our non-profit and small business clients. The person occupying this role will spend his or her time making iterative changes and bug fixes to design, functionality, and backend improvements of the dozens of websites Cornershop manages and maintains. Tasks may include setting up WordPress custom post types, fields and taxonomies; troubleshooting server errors and migrating sites to hosts; and minor HTML, CSS (SASS), and JS coding for custom themes. Additionally, this position may be responsible for developing and maintaining custom WordPress plugins.
Our ideal candidate is a hard-working, curious troubleshooter comfortable working independently with little supervision, but who also enjoys working as part of a team that includes developers and non-developers. Since we're a distributed shop, you’ll get to work from home! Cool, right?
Specifically, the things we’re looking for include:

  • Experience with receiving potentially vague end-user bug reports, recreating the issues, and diving into the codebase to quickly identify root causes
  • Significant experience with WordPress theming: template hierarchy, hooks, WP_Query, etc.
  • Strong knowledge of HTML5 markup and CSS3
  • Ability to write CSS/SASS for cross-browser, responsive design (not just by using Bootstrap)
  • Decent JavaScript skills (particularly in jQuery and/or the Node.js ecosystem)
  • Experience managing codebases and deploying websites onto third-party hosts via git, and/or sFTP, making DNS record changes, etc
  • Past experience with quickly and effectively maintaining/troubleshooting/supporting code written by other developers
  • Familiarity with command line tools like git, gulp and wp-cli
  • Ability to laugh at our stupid jokes (and the occasional good one)
  • Familiarity with current (and evolving) best practices in front-end dev regarding semantics, performance, cross-browser consistency, etc.
  • Ability to not lose your s#!% when you occasionally get feedback like “can we make the logo bigger?” or “change the padding by 1px” (and then getting asked to change it back), which may happen despite our best efforts
  • Willingness to work in a fast-paced environment (we keep pretty busy!) and manage a workload of several projects at a time
  • Superb written and oral communication skills
30d

    • WordPress Developer & Support Specialist

    Cornershop Creative (https://cornershopcreative.com) is seeking an awesome, U.S.-based WordPress developer to join our distributed team.

    The core responsibility for this position will be investigating, troubleshooting, and coding solutions for WordPress-based websites and applications for our non-profit and small business clients. The person occupying this role will spend his or her time making iterative changes and bug fixes to design, functionality, and backend improvements of the dozens of websites Cornershop manages and maintains. Tasks may include setting up WordPress custom post types, fields and taxonomies; troubleshooting server errors and migrating sites to hosts; and minor HTML, CSS (SASS), and JS coding for custom themes. Additionally, this position may be responsible for developing and maintaining custom WordPress plugins.

    Our ideal candidate is a hard-working, curious troubleshooter comfortable working independently with little supervision, but who also enjoys working as part of a team that includes developers and non-developers. Since we’re a distributed shop, you’ll get to work from home! Cool, right?

    Specifically, the things we’re looking for include:



    • Experience with receiving potentially vague end-user bug reports, recreating the issues, and diving into the codebase to quickly identify root causes


    • Significant experience with WordPress theming: template hierarchy, hooks, WP_Query, etc.


    • Strong knowledge of HTML5 markup and CSS3


    • Ability to write CSS/SASS for cross-browser, responsive design (not just by using Bootstrap)


    • Decent JavaScript skills (particularly in jQuery and/or the Node.js ecosystem)


    • Experience managing codebases and deploying websites onto third-party hosts via git, and/or sFTP, making DNS record changes, etc


    • Past experience with quickly and effectively maintaining/troubleshooting/supporting code written by other developers


    • Familiarity with command line tools like git, gulp and wp-cli


    • Ability to laugh at our stupid jokes (and the occasional good one)


    • Familiarity with current (and evolving) best practices in front-end dev regarding semantics, performance, cross-browser consistency, etc.


    • Ability to not lose your s#!% when you occasionally get feedback like “can we make the logo bigger?” or “change the padding by 1px” (and then getting asked to change it back), which may happen despite our best efforts


    • Willingness to work in a fast-paced environment (we keep pretty busy!) and manage a workload of several projects at a time


    • Superb written and oral communication skills

    Other stuff we’d love it if you’re good at, but aren’t requirements:



    • Working with and customizing BuddyPress


    • Troubleshooting mySQL performance issues (and writing performant queries)


    • Familiarity with Apache/nginx configuration, tuning and troubleshooting


    • Ability to understand and work with common third-party REST APIs


    • Develop ingenious scripts to facilitate complicated cross-platform content migrations


    • Using Photoshop and understanding challenges in designing for the web


    • Working with nonprofit CRM tools such as Salsa, Luminate Online, Engaging Networks, Blue State Digital, and Classy


    • Remembering to un-mute yourself before talking on conference calls


    • Being passionate about progressive causes


    • Writing basic bash scripts and performing other devops/Linux sysadmin kinds of stuff

    Cornershop Creative is an award-winning online services agency committed to listening carefully to our non-profit and small business clients and helping them achieve their goals. Our designs are beautiful, and our websites are creative and innovative. Learn more about us at https://cornershopcreative.com/.

    To apply, send an email to jobs@cornershopcreative.com with the following:



    • Your résumé, which should include an indication of which American state you live and work in


    • A brief cover letter, explaining why you’re excited about this opportunity


    • Links to work you’ve done that we should see, such as recent websites, git repos, or contributed plugins/modules/themes


    • Ideal salary range

     

    U.S. Applicants only!

    Please be sure to include all of these items — to save everyone valuable time we’ll throw out incomplete applications. Thanks for understanding.

    Cornershop is an equal opportunity employer.

    How to apply

items.title: Close.io: Customer Success Manager - North America
items.content:
Customer Success Manager - North America

Posted Oct 4

Close.io
Headquarters: San Francisco
https://close.io

At Close.io we’re building the sales communication platform of the future. We’ve built a next-generation CRM that eliminates manual data entry and helps sales teams close more deals. We’re looking to hire a Customer Success Manager to join our team and work with our rapidly expanding customer base.

The Close.io Success Team is the face of our company, acting as the bridge between where the product is today and where the product is heading for the future. The Customer Success Manager (CSM) has dual responsibilities: on-board larger customers to help them set up for success and deepen relationships with our existing customers to increase the value they get from our service. They will be responsible for building and improving all processes related to customer on-boarding, growth and overall success with Close.io. 

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Virtually train and onboard new and existing customers
  • Communicate effectively with all Close.io customers, including CEOs and VP level executives
  • Identify expansion opportunities and up-sell customerS
  • Host in person customer events, some travel required
  • Create FAQs, white papers, videos, and host webinars

YOU SHOULD...

  • Have a minimum of 1 year in B2B SaaS experience (customer success, account management, or support)
  • Act as a trusted advisor for our customers through frontline sales experience of minimum 1 year
  • Have excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Be able to slice and dice customer data in Excel (vlookups, pivots, conditionals)
  • Have the ability to create high fidelity customer presentations (Keynote, PPT)
  • Be available to work normal U.S. business hours

BONUS POINTS IF YOU...

  • You have experience working in a startup environment or as a remote worker

WHY WORK WITH US...?!

  • We’re a very small team doing very big things! Your work will make a huge impact and your voice will be heard
  • Competitive salary, healthcare, dental, and retirement benefits package
  • Work remotely
  • 2x all-expense paid worldwide team retreats annually

Apply for this position

https://jobs.lever.co/close.io/e0cf4b26-d851-4835-bfc1-395a8bf61cc1?lever-origin=applied&lever-source%5B%5D=WeWorkRemotelyCSM

items.title: Technical Support Engineer - OpenShift.io - Red Hat, Inc. - Remote
items.content:
Technical Support Engineer - OpenShift.io
Red Hat, Inc. -Remote
At Red Hat, we connect an innovative community of customers, partners, and contributors to deliver an open source stack of trusted, high-performing solutions. We offer cloud, Linux, middleware, storage, and virtualization technologies, together with award-winning global customer support, consulting, and implementation services. Red Hat is a rapidly growing company supporting more than 90% of Fortune 500 companies.

Job summaryThe Red Hat OpenShift.io Support Engineering team is looking for a Technical Support Engineer on the US East Coast. In this role, you will collaborate with our customers' top developers and architects to understand, troubleshoot, and resolve issues with OpenShift.io, an online development environment for building container-based applications. You'll also partner closely with Red Hat's development and technical support engineering teams to help resolve issues quickly and efficiently. Preferred work locations are Raleigh, NC or Westford, MA. Well-qualified, home-based candidates on the US East Coast will also be considered for a remote position.

Primary job responsibilities
  • Understand, troubleshoot, and debug customer issues to ensure they are able to realize maximum value from Red Hat's OpenShift.io
  • Partner with the Eclipse Che and OpenShift Origin communities to develop and review patches and test cases
  • Guide customer-facing support cases, exceed customer expectations, and provide outstanding customer service
  • Maintain technical knowledge of all aspects of our technology and market
  • Share your knowledge gained from troubleshooting issues by contributing to the global Red Hat knowledge management system
  • Work closely with Red Hat development engineering and assist production support engineers and technical account managers
  • Maintain a commitment to providing the best experience possible for Red Hat customers

Required skills
  • Experience with OpenShift, Docker, Kubernetes, and other container tools
  • Software engineering experience with programming languages, like Java, Python, Ruby, C++, and experience writing patches and pull requests
  • Ability and desire to quickly learn new languages and technologies
  • Bachelor's degree in computer science, computer engineering, or technology-related discipline, or equivalent experience within the enterprise IT
The following experience will be considered a plus:
  • Java development experience
  • Experience with Apache Maven, including working behind proxies, repository settings, and dependency management
  • Experience with RESTful APIs
  • Experience developing in a Linux or UNIX-like environment
  • Experience supporting Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) applications
  • Virtualization with VMware, EC2, Google Cloud Platform, Docker, Microsoft Azure, or Red Hat OpenStack
  • Experience with application servers like Apache Tomcat, JBoss AS, or WildFly
  • Networking experience, including software-defined networking
  • Experience with Infrastructure-as-a-Service (IaaS) environments, like Red Hat OpenStack, Microsoft Azure, and Amazon Web Services (AWS)
  • Upstream involvement in open source projects, including submitting patches for upstream inclusion

items.title: Customer Support Executive
items.content:
DESCRIPTION:

PayAsUGym is an online marketplace (think Rightmove or AirBnB but for fitness) and is one of the fastest growing companies in the UK. Since launch in 2011 the company has successfully established the largest gym network in the country with more than 2,700 participating gyms, health clubs and fitness studios and over 500,000 registered users.
This full time role will require you to deliver exceptional support to our customers via email, chat or phone regarding our products or service.
This role represents an excellent opportunity for someone who is resilient, creative and interested in a fast growth, technology based fitness start up.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:

Customer Support: You will primarily be responsible for handling inbound and outbound customer service queries and complaints, via phone, email and Live Chat on the website, identifying problems quickly and resolving them to provide the best possible outcome for the customer.
You will also be responsible for keeping a team of remote agents up to date with issues and changes on the website.

Cross-department communication: Working with the Operations team to resolve issues between the venue and the user.
You will also be required to closely liaise with the Development team to understand website changes, and how these will impact the customer experience.
You will be required to assist the Marketing team for periods of time, by contacting customers via phone, to provide information for marketing projects.

Assist with ad-hoc projects:
As a fast growing start-up business our world moves pretty quickly which means everyone in the team needs to be ready and willing to support the wider business meet its goals through ad-hoc projects which will involve working with other departments in the business. This means you will get experience working alongside the Sales, Account Management, and Business Operations teams.


DESIRED SKILLS:
As you will be dealing directly with our customers, you must be polite, reliable and resilient. You must also have a clear and concise writing style and it is vital that you are friendly and confident on the phone.
We pride ourselves on delivering a consistently outstanding service, which leads the industry and underpins our reputation in the marketplace. You must also have a strong ability to use MS Office and web-based customer service software such as Zendesk.


EXPERIENCE:
2 years relevant customer experience
SALARY: £20-25k per annum dependent upon experience

WORKING HOURS: Monday-Friday, normal working hours are 9am-6pm

LOCATION: Fulham, SW6

BENEFITS:
Unlimited holiday
2 duvet days per year
Free access to all fitness services listed on PayAsUGym

items.title: Customer Success Manager (CSM)
items.content:
* Do you want to *know everything* about your *prospects' plans and digital roadmap*?
* Are you great at *understanding their needs* and *communicating a service* to digital people?
* Can you *manage a sales pipeline*, expectations and a *busy pitch and demo schedule*?
* Can you *guide your prospects* with best practice and deliver a great outcome for them?
* Do you have a proven successful track record of *achieving sales quotas*?

If the answer to all of that is a resounding *YES*, then you’re who we’re looking for to join our team.

We’ve got clients who want to understand their users’ digital (websites, apps etc) user experiences, we’ve got the users who will offer their opinions and feedback – what we need is someone to work with our prospects to help us understand their requirements, translating this into how our UX Testing platform services them which gives them the insights and outcomes they need.

_Who will you be working with?_

Internally you’ll work most closely with our UX Research team and our lead-gen marketing team, who have a wealth of client knowledge and will work with you to help you to get to grips with what we do, who your prospects are and how to shape the pitch and proposition to your sectors and potential prospects.

You will be pitching at digital professionals from UX to Customer Insight and eCommerce to Marketing. Our clients are mainly mid-large recognisable brand names (our website has a few listed if you’re interested) across every sector from supermarkets to travel to financial services – but there is plenty of market to go at and a great commission structure to reward your efforts.

_How do we do all this?_

We talk to our clients, we scope out the work to be done, we programme their research and then deliver a range of testing projects all aimed at ensuring our clients improve digital conversions, customer engagement, retention and satisfaction. Our user research platform is where it all happens – from the experience capture to the analysis, to the sharing of insight – available in your browser whenever you need it.

_What makes us different?_

It’s never solely our opinion – we’re totally impartial. We believe that the only opinion that matters is the customers’ – not ours, not yours – only theirs. And we’re fast, with results in days not weeks or months!

_What do we want from you?_

At WhatUsersDo.com, we believe that sales is more than a job, it’s a calling! Our sales team is about more than just closing deals; it’s about taking ownership of a relationship and identifying the value for the client. We believe in solving the KEY problems facing our customers everyday – how do they improve sales and satisfaction and their overall customer experience. We bring the user to their table in a fast, easy, cost competitive and actionable way and the end result is that our customers love WhatUsersDo.com… AND IT SHOWS. Our growth so far has been tremendous (85% growth year on year) we want you to be part of this year’s growth.

As a person you are a 'larger' contract hunter with a proven track record closing benefit led deals in excess of £10-£30K per annum with senior level buyers at mid-large level companies. If you are Intelligent, quick-witted and persistent & understand how to evangelize a product while broadening a customer’s perception of its value then you will fit right in.

You will sweat the details and the nuances and know that an obsession with tone, type and targeting delivers results time after time. You own your sales process (we will also train you on what’s been working so far) and you obsess over optimizing every piece of it. You know that securing a relationship is more than just the pitch deck and a broad smile – we will arm you with case studies, insight reports (specific to the client) and full UX consultancy support and back-up.

_What are some of the things you will be doing?_

* Generate new business opportunities to fuel your pipeline
* Drive commercial opportunities from qualified expressions of interest
* Passionately evangelize remote user research & testing to mid-large company & Enterprise business leaders
* Conduct game changing product demo’s
* Manage full sales-cycle in a consultative manner, including contract negotiations, proposal creation etc
* Optimize pipeline while meeting the weekly/monthly activity goals you are set
* Prioritize opportunities and manage your time & resources appropriately
* Coach team members and accept coaching whenever it is given
* Do something amazing to build the growth every week

_Skills & expertise?_

Really strong digital skills and expertise you may have worked in some of the following sectors? - eCommerce, Analytics, Customer Insight, Market Research, Web Design, CRM, Software, Payment, Email, SaaS or digital Agency

* Entrepreneurial mindset
* Proven successful track record of achieving sales quotas
* Obvious passion, intelligence, humour and wit
* 3 - 7+ years of sales experience or provable track record of exceeding a consistent quota
* Able to thrive in a maturing environment—moves quickly, thinks strategically and is good at tactical execution
* Passion for web technologies and great User Experience
* Excellent written & verbal communication skills
* Ability to multi-task, prioritize and manage time effectively

_Bonus Qualifications:_

* Network of contacts in leadership roles in eCommerce, marketing, UX, digital, user research or customer insights
* Experience selling to Travel, digital agencies, eCommerce, financial services, public sector or web/mobile gaming companies

WhatUsersDo was set up over five years ago so anyone, in any size or type of organisation, can remotely gather user research from across the world with real people. Today our remote user experience testing platform is used by leading organisations such as Virgin Atlantic, Deckers & Money Advice Service to radically improve their understanding of peoples’ digital experiences and to drive user research improvement through insight (rather than just rely on hunches, instinct or opinion).

We are based in North London (right next door to a pub & a theatre!) and there is coffee and cake ongoing. It’s a nice new open plan office with a very friendly bunch of digital professionals - you will fit right in!

*Competitive Salary - + Competitive Commission: For Right Candidate (OTE £50K+)*

No recruitment agencies please! – No really, please don’t call
